main event: A report detailing observations of UFOs over Tempelhof Air Base, Berlin on 21 June 1957.
interesting points: The report mentions two observers seeing two UFOs, while one observer reported three UFOs., Observations showed one UFO was stationary while two others followed a northeasterly path., Both moving UFOs were reported to have stopped abruptly after traversing approximately one-fourth of the visible horizon., The objects were visible for two to five minutes., The preliminary analysis suggested that the observed objects could possibly be propaganda balloons.
sighted object: two to three unidentified flying objects
witness description: AMN Middleton, A/SC Jack R. Middleton, and A/SC Cecil L. Sparkman, all considered reliable observers.
